name: Affinity Photo Document
summary: Learn about .AFPHOTO files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Affinity Photo is an alternative to Adobe Photoshop that professional photographers and other digital artists utilize to modify photographs and create images. Just as Photoshop saves users' in-progress images as .PSD files, Affinity Photo saves in-progress images in AFPHOTO files.

To create an AFPHOTO with the Windows and Mac versions of Affinity Photo, select File → New..., modify the image, then select File → Save or Save As. After saving your progress as an AFPHOTO file, you can close it and re-open it for further editing.

instructions: You can open an AFPHOTO file with Serif Affinity Photo in Windows, macOS, and iOS. To open an AFPHOTO file with the Windows or Mac version of Affinity Photo, select File → Open from the program's menu bar.

AFPHOTO files can be converted to a number of different formats using the Serif Affinity Photo software. The following export file formats are supported.

PSD - Adobe Photoshop DocumentPDF - Portable Document FormatJPG - JPEG ImagePNG - Portable Network GraphicGIF - Graphical Interchange FormatEPS - Encapsulated PostScriptSVG - Scalable Vector GraphicsTIFF - Tagged Image File FormatTGA - Targa GraphicEXR - OpenEXR ImageHDR - High Dynamic Range Image
